  "Allegations" : "PLAINTIFFS ALLEGE THAT THE REPRESENTATIVE SOLICITED THE PURCHASE OF PROMISSORY NOTES AND THAT THE ENTITY THAT ISSUED THE NOTES FILED FOR BANKRUPTCY CAUSING THE NOTES TO BECOME WORTHLESS RESULTING IN THE LOSS OF THE INVESTMENTS IN THE NOTES.",

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT ALLEGES THAT THE REPRESENTATIVE SOLICITED HIM TO PURCHASE A $74,000 NOTE. CLIENT FURTHER ALLEGES THAT THE ENTITY THAT ISSUED THE NOTE WENT BANKRUPT AND THAT HE LOST HIS ENTIRE INVESTMENT. NOTABLY, THE REPRESENTATIVE WAS TERMINATED BY THE FIRM UPON DISCOVERING THE REPRESENTATIVE'S ACTIVITIES IN CONNECTION WITH SUBJECT NOTES. IN ADDITION, FINRA INITIATED AN INQUIRY (EXAM NO. 20060052520) TO THE FIRM IN 2006 REGARDING THIS MATTER AND, BASED ON THE FIRM'S RESPONSE, DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO BASIS UPON WHICH TO TAKE ACTION AGAINST THE FIRM OR INVESTIGATE FURTHER.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$74,000.00",
  "Damages Granted" : "$48,100.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "08-02330"
}
